title: 103_hr3167
content: The Act "Unemployment Compensation Amendments of 1993" extends the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program until February 5, 1994. It also adjusts the weeks of benefits available after October 2, 1993. The Act extends the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program and adjusts the weeks of benefits available. Clause (i) is modified by substituting numbers, while clauses (ii), (iii), (iv), and (v) do not apply. Subparagraph A of paragraph (1) is also modified. The Act modifies various clauses and paragraphs, including adjusting dates for final phase-out and conforming amendments. The amendments made by this section will apply. The amendments made by this section will apply to weeks of unemployment starting after October 2, 1993. Repeal of the disregard of rights to regular compensation is effective immediately, except for eligibility from accounts established before October 2, 1993. SEC. 4. WORKER PROFILING. The State agency must establish a profiling system for new claimants to identify those likely to exhaust regular compensation and in need of job search assistance services for successful reemployment. Claimants identified will be referred to reemployment services and follow-up information on services received and employment outcomes will be collected. The State agency must establish a profiling system for new claimants to identify those likely to exhaust regular compensation and in need of job search assistance services for successful reemployment. Claimants subsequent to receiving such services and utilizes such information in making identifications pursuant to subparagraph (A); and meets such other requirements as the Secretary of Labor determines are appropriate. Whenever the Secretary of Labor finds a failure to comply with the requirements, further payments to the State will be withheld until compliance is met. The Social Security Act is amended to include a participation requirement for claimants referred to reemployment services. Claimants must participate in these services unless exempted by the State agency. The Secretary of Labor will provide technical assistance. The Secretary of Labor will provide technical assistance to States for implementing the required profiling system. A report to Congress on the system's operation and effectiveness is due within 3 years. A conforming amendment repeals Section 4 of the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Amendments of 1993. Effective dates are specified. The Compensation Amendments of 1993 (Public Law 103-6) are repealed, with specific effective dates for different provisions. A technical amendment to the Unemployment Trust Fund is made regarding transfers between accounts. The text discusses adjustments in transfers between accounts in the Employment Security Administration, ensuring proper balance between transfers and payments. SEC. 6. EXTENSION OF REPORTING DATE FOR ADVISORY COUNCIL. Section 908(f) of the Social Security Act is amended to change the time frames mentioned in paragraphs (1) and (2). Additionally, Section 1621 of the Social Security Act is modified to increase the sponsorship period for aliens under the Supplemental Security Income Program from three years to five years, with an effective date of January 1, 1994. This change is later reversed to reinstate the previous three-year sponsorship period. The Social Security Act is amended to change time frames, including reducing the sponsorship period for aliens under the Supplemental Security Income Program from five years to three years, effective October 1, 1996. SEC. 8. TREATMENT OF RAILROAD WORKERS. The extension of benefits for railroad workers under the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 1991 is amended to extend until January 1, 1994. Benefits termination date is changed to March 26, 1994. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATES. The repeal of the disregard of rights to regular compensation applies to weeks of unemployment after October 2, 1993, except for emergency unemployment compensation eligibility from an account established before October 3, 1993. Amendments are made to extend benefits for railroad workers until February 5, 1994. Amendments to the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 1991 extend benefits for railroad workers until April 30, 1994. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
